pages.text: Symphysops is a small Ordovician trilobite found in many countries all over the world. It is a member of Cyclopygidae, a family of large eyed and likely pelagic swimming trilobites. It likely had a pelagic lifestyle, evidenced by its large eyes that merged at the front of the head and its fossils are often found in association with other pelagic trilobites.
$(l)Eats:$() Fish Food$(br)$(l)Breeds with:$() Fish Food$(br)$(l)Egg Type:$() Drops Egg$(br)$(l)Method of Obtaining:$() Bucket
